Fields.DialogueText: Captain! There you are!
Did you expect to find me sailing away on a life raft?
No time for that silver-tongued wit of yours, Captain! It's an emergency!
Icebergs?
No!
Morganas!?
Worse!
Well spit it out, woman, we haven't got all day!
It's Jenkins!

Fields.MenuText: He's fallen overboard?

Fields.DialogueText: I wish...
Vendetta!
He's made off with my prized possession! He heard of my biographical notebooks and made off with his! I didn't write anything damning, but... it's like he's reading my diary!

Fields.MenuText: He's been kidnapped by a Morgana fleet?
He's succumbed to scurvy?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, relax. I'll help you look for him.
*ALARM*
Just as soon as we deal with these Morganas!
@BATTLE
He eats better than that. Too good, if we're being candid.
I wouldn't inflict him on them.
Where did you last see Jenkins?
He was making his way down to the engine room. He has to be here somewhere.
I know you said you hadn't written anything too harsh, but...
I may have been a little... forward with my feelings towards him.
What happened to counting backwards from ten?
I tried, but each passing number felt more like the countdown to a ticking time bomb!

Fields.MenuText: It isn't like you to be so private.

Fields.DialogueText: I know what you mean. I've prided myself on saying what I feel regardless of the situation. Something about it being written down just irks me!

Fields.MenuText: I dread to see what's written in my book...

Fields.DialogueText: You should dread instead what would happen after reading it without my permission.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should invest in some kind of padlock.

Fields.DialogueText: And if I lose the key? You don't want to be around for that, Captain.
Captain! Over there! He's trying to escape back above decks!
You'll never take me alive, Vendetta!
*ALARM*
This is getting ridiculous... Either way, we need to take out these Morganas. To the bridge!
@BATTLE
There you are! We've got you now! Nowhere left to run!
I don't plan on running anywhere...
*Gasp* You can't possibly mean...
That's exactly right! Now for me to unleash my secret technique!
I... impossible! No one has ever been able to pull that off!
Something you don't know about me, Vendetta! I'm not just anyone! HAAAA--
*HIT*
*SOCK*
OW!
Captain! That really hurt! Isn't that a little uncalled for!?
You two are acting like children, so I will treat you like children.
Vendetta started it!
No I didn't! Captain, Jenkins is telling lies again!

Fields.MenuText: I'm putting you both in time-out!

Fields.DialogueText: Guh! But that's not fair!

Fields.MenuText: You're both on latrine duty for a week.

Fields.DialogueText: Buh! Thanks a lot, Jenkins...

Fields.MenuText: Why did you need to chase him in the first place? Can't you appear wherever?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you tell me not to hunt my crew!
Apologies, Captain. As you know, I'm not the most model crewmate, but I always try my best.
I'm fine with people constructively criticising me to my face, but having it written down behind my back is something I cannot forgive.
Why don't you go ahead and read it, then!?
*ALARM*
Morganas come first! Both of you, with me!
@BATTLE
Are you sure you're okay with me reading this?
If it's the difference between you trusting me or not, then so be it. Just know that it'll pain me to see you do so.
*Ahem*
He didn't even give it a second thought...
"Jenkins is one of the most irritable crewmates aboard this ship. His laziness and negligence could sometimes be seen as treasonous." AHA!
Keep reading.
"Still, it is always apparent how hard he tries to rectify his mistakes. Sure, his flaws tally many in number but, with each screaming match, they drop off one by one."
*Sigh*
"He is a valuable member of the team and, if nothing else, is solely responsible for keeping me on my toes."
Finished? Good! Now give me this back!
Vendetta... I...
Save it! Captain, thank you for your support. I'll be attending to my duties now.
Captain. I had no idea. I'm sorry.

Fields.MenuText: It isn't me you should be apologising to, is it?

Fields.DialogueText: You're absolutely right...

Fields.MenuText: Vendetta could never hate someone.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try my best to make amends.

Fields.MenuText: Next time, be sure to trust the people around you.

Fields.DialogueText: I feel incredibly ashamed of myself.
*ALARM*
No time for moping now, sailor. We have company!
@BATTLE
Captain? Why did you call me in... Ah, I see.
Have a seat, Vendetta. Someone has something they'd like to say to you.
HA! This ought to be good.
Vendetta, please, just hear me out.
Fine. But bore me and I'll feed you to the Morganas!
What Morganas?
*ALARM*
How... How did you do that...?
Don't test me, boy.
@BATTLE
Vendetta, I shouldn't have snooped through your belongings.
No, you shouldn't have.
I was insecure and angry, but I can see how much you value the crew, myself included. I humbly apologise.
HA! Water under the bridge!
Just like that?

Fields.MenuText: Vendetta isn't one to hold a grudge.

Fields.DialogueText: True! I'd rather patch things up or eliminate you entirely!

Fields.MenuText: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth, you fool...

Fields.DialogueText: HA! This must be your lucky day, Jenkins. I'm in a surprisingly good mood!

Fields.MenuText: It was a good apology.

Fields.DialogueText: I could feel the genuineness in his words.
You know, we're all children of this earth. It isn't right to mistrust or deceive one's fellow man. We can all learn a lesson from what transpired here today. And with that, I'll take my leave.
Captain... Do you think perhaps Jenkins only exists in our imagination? Like some kind of spiritual siren guiding us to a better tomorrow?
Jenkins, look out for that bookcase!
*CRASH*
I guess not.
Vendetta? Everything all right? You look troubled?
Ha... I'm fine, Captain. It's just... something feels off.

Fields.MenuText: Jenkins up to his old tricks again?

Fields.DialogueText: No, I believe I've set him straight now.

Fields.MenuText: Something in the water?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps. The tide seems to be turning, which is usually a good sign for sailors. But...

Fields.MenuText: Could it just be your imagination?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Looks like your sixth sense was right after--
*ALARM*
What the...?
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
This has to be some kind of sick joke, right? Look out to the horizon. There's no end to them!
Captain!
Yes!?
Permission to boss you around for a little bit without impeding on your pride as a captain!
... I'll allow it.
I thought something felt amiss and I had already begun constructing a plan for such a doomsday scenario. I'll need you to follow my plan, okay?
Vendetta, I'm not sure about--
Do you trust me!?
... What do you need me to do?
First things first: there seems to be a scouting party of Morganas in close vicinity. Let's take them out and make our escape so we can regroup.
Copy that. You heard her, men! Get to work!
@BATTLE
We barely made it out of there alive...
It was all thanks to your leadership, Captain.
Are you joking!? You're the one who came up with the plan!
No, Captain. You are truly an excellent leader. The crew as well. They were an asset to our escape.
Uh... okay... Tell me, what do you think about Jenkins?
Jenkins? He's a valuable member of the team and a trusted ally of mine. I would give my life to see him returned safely from harm.
Who the hell are you!?
AH! Apologies, Captain. Whenever I begin to strategize, a switch flips in my mind. The usual rage that flows within me subsides into a gentle breeze.

Fields.MenuText: Even your signature "HA" turned into an "AH"...

Fields.DialogueText: AH! I didn't even notice, Captain. I will try to rectify this after our victory is assured.

Fields.MenuText: You didn't become like this before?

Fields.DialogueText: There's a key difference between, let's say... stomping an overconfident seaman in a game of chess and expertly manoeuvring through a fleet of Morgana.

Fields.MenuText: How long is this going to last? It's creeping me out...

Fields.DialogueText: Bear with it, Captain. The quicker we win, the quicker my usual persona will return.
So what must we do?
There's no way I am powerful enough to take on such a monumental army. However, I thought perhaps we'd let gravity do the work for us.
Explain.
I know a minefield near here. If we can bait the fleet into following us through, we can sail off into the sunset while they explode in our wake.
Do you have any idea how dangerous that is?
All the idea in the world, Captain.
*ALARM*
Perhaps there's something else I could leave to you as well.
AH! They're faster than I thought, but no bother. We'll just have to push back equally as hard!
@BATTLE
Is that it? In the distance?
Wouldn't be much of a minefield if you could tell by sight, would it?
All right, that's a yes. We have our course.
Triple-checked.
*ALARM*
They're here.
Are you sure about this, Vendetta?
AH! When I'm back to my usual self, I'll enjoy making you eat those words.
They're gaining on us! Either we're destroyed by the fleet or we're pushed into the mines!
Steady...
Steady...
Vendetta!
Now!
*POMPF*
What is this? A smokescreen?
Turn the sails! Quickly now! We have to turn around!
Back into the Morgana fleet!?
I lied about the safe route. We'll pass through undetected while they trip the mines.
I'm not sure if--
*POMPF*
It's working! I can hear them getting blown to bits!
Thank goodness.

Fields.MenuText: How did you think so far ahead?

Fields.DialogueText: AH! This is just like chess but in real life. It's natural to be forward thinking at all times.

Fields.MenuText: Why didn't you tell me about the smokescreen? Or the fakeout!?

Fields.DialogueText: AH! I fear you would have opposed the idea. (Or had a heart attack...)

Fields.MenuText: Can this Vendetta stay forever?

Fields.DialogueText: AH! Apologies, Captain. If you can't handle me at my rage-infused, demon-blooded destroyer, you don't deserve me at my cool-headed master tactician.
It looks like there are still a few stragglers. Easy pickings if you ask me! Don't sound the alarm - it will only draw attention. I'll take care of them personally!
@BATTLE
That looks to have been the last of them.
I think so too. Great work, Vendetta. I should have never doubted you.
It's okay, Captain. I'm just relieved we all managed to escape unscathed.
So what happens now?
What do you mean?
Will you return to your regular self?
Likely. As soon as my body realizes the battle is won.

Fields.MenuText: Do you prefer being this tactical or unleashing destruction?

Fields.DialogueText: You talk as if I'm two separate beings, Captain. Those sides of me are one and the same, don't forget that.

Fields.MenuText: Any advice for me and the crew while you have your head screwed on?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. Tell the men to leave the seats down in the head!
When it is my round for latrine duty, I'm baffled that such talented sailors, able to fire on a Morgana several hundred yards away, have such terrible aim at close quarters!

Fields.MenuText: Thank you again, Vendetta. You really saved us.

Fields.DialogueText: AH! No need, Captain. I look forward to being saved by you next time.
*Cough cough!*
Vendetta, are you okay?
Vende--?
HA! Captain, you look like you've seen a ghost!
Welcome back, Vendetta. We missed you.
Welcome back? Did I go somewhere?
Do you remember our recent fight with the Morganas?
Of course I do, I'm not some kind of cretin! We, uh... there was a minefield? And, uh... it's slipping my mind...
Don't think too much on it, Vendetta. Just know you saved us all.
HA! Well, that's to be expected, isn't it!
*ALARM*
Why don't you see if taking out these Morganas helps jog your memory?
With pleasure!
@BATTLE
Captain! Take a seat and join me for a meal!
Gladly. How are you holding up after...
Hm?
Never mind...
Save your breath, Captain. Tuck into some of this food.
Are you a food connoisseur?
HA! Is the Pope Catholic!? Although, the UK isn't really... praised for their daringness when it comes to cuisine.

Fields.MenuText: Do you miss the UK at all?
What was your favorite thing about the UK?
What's the UK food you like the most?

Fields.DialogueText: Sometimes. I try not to look back on stuff like that, though. It only serves to slow you down.
I loved attending football matches. Screaming abuse at the enemy team's fans when they start losing lights a fire inside me!
Fish and chips? It's not gourmet, but it gets the job done. I think it sums up the UK mentality rather well, in fact.
*ALARM*
Morganas! How dare they interrupt our lovely meal!
Quickly, Captain! Let's get to work!
@BATTLE
Sigh...
Calm waters today.
SIGH...
Should be smooth sailing from here on out.
I SAID SIGH!
Oh, Vendetta, when did you get here...? Something on your mind?
I was just admiring this photo of Camicia Nera.
Camicia Nera... The Italian Belle?
Look at her, Captain! How extravagant does she look!?
She certainly has a flair for the dangerous.
Fashion is a driving force of the modern-day economy, Captain. You shouldn't overlook its significance.

Fields.MenuText: Are you friendly with Nera?
The UK are fairly well known for their fashion, right?
I forgot I was speaking to a bona fide fashionista.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Captain, it happens to the best of us.
"Friendly" may be a little generous. I mainly keep her around so I can stay up to date with the latest fashion trends. She's always one step ahead even for someone like me!
If I could wear a dress designed by Charles James, I could die a happy Belle!
We've picked up a whole mess of clothes from our travels. Some from different countries, even. Why don't we see if anything piques your interest?
HA! Captain, that's a great idea! Just you wait, Nera! I'll pip you to the post this time for sure!
*ALARM*
And for my first runway, I'll be sporting an outfitted war garment bloodied red with the innards of my enemies!
@BATTLE
There certainly are a lot of clothes in here. You really weren't lying!
We pass through so many places on our travels. Either as gifts or items tangled in our fishing line, it seemed a shame to throw them away.
Did you just say you plucked some of these clothes out of the ocean?
HA! ... You must be hearing things. Let's keep looking...
I need something that will still allow me to move freely. I don't like having my legs restricted. I'm not partial to either dresses, skirts, or trousers but nothing that will slow me down.
What about colour? How do you feel about...

Fields.MenuText: Red?
White?
Blue?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a little elegant, don't you think? I'm not going to a ball. Besides, I wear enough red as is. Morgana blood stains something fierce!
Too easy to stain. I can't be thinking about whether or not a certain action I take will ruin my clothing. It's too distracting.
It may be good for camouflaging myself over a body of water, but I fear my team wouldn't be able to spot me either! The last thing I want is a cannon ruining my pristine new dress!
Vendetta! What about this?
That...? I don't know, Captain.
Why not? It's perfect for you!
Something like that? On me? I don't know if I have the style to pull that off...
Of course you do! You're just as stylish as any other Belle out there! You deserve to wear whatever you want.
*Sigh* Very well.
*ALARM*
Maybe defeating some Morganas will give me the confidence boost I need to squeeze into that...
@BATTLE
Come on out, then!
I don't want to!
Why not?
It's embarrassing!
It's just me out here. I won't say anything, I promise.
... Well? It looks ridiculous, right?
Wow... Vendetta... that gown... you look...
I knew it! I'm taking it off!
Now, wait a minute. What happened to the bravado of the Vendetta I once knew?
I'm not exactly the peak of femininity, Captain. I've come to terms with that in my own way, but... when I'm forced to wear something like this... I can't help but feel self-conscious.

Fields.MenuText: I think you look great.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that, Captain. More than you can imagine.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always felt this way?

Fields.DialogueText: One of the reasons I'm so obsessed with Nera is that not only is she fashionable, but she also helps me find clothes to match my body type.

Fields.MenuText: Black really suits you.

Fields.DialogueText: It is slimming, I suppose...
That settles it! We'll have to throw you in at the deep end!
Whatever do you mean?
*ALARM*
I'll explain after we take out these Morganas!
@BATTLE
I can't believe you talked me into this...
What's the problem?
People are looking at me...!
Of course they are! They're admiring your style! We even found a use for your stillettos other than throwing them!
This is harder than any mission I've ever fought...
Excuse me!
Oh? Yes, what is it, darling?
Um... Are you a model?
HA! You're too cute for your own good, you know that?
Could I have your autograph? I want to be a model someday too!
Uh...

Fields.MenuText: Why not?
Are you going to disappoint your fan?
Do you plan on saying no to that face?

Fields.DialogueText: Sure, Sweetie. Some advice - eat like it's your last meal, don't take any nonsense from people around you, and learn to cook. It'll be a lifesaver.
Thanks! I don't really understand anything you just said, but you look pretty!
HA! That's another route you can take in life, as well! Now, go on and run along back to your parents!
Thanks again!
Now, do you believe me?
It'll take a lot more than a child complimenting my dress for me to feel comfortable in my own skin. Although... it's a start, I guess.
Wonderful! Now, quickly get that dress off and get back on the ship!
Captain! I knew you were forward, but I never once thought you could be so vulgar!
It's not that I dislike it, per se... But, especially when I'm in this dress, I'd hoped you could be a little more considerate...
What are you talking about, Vendetta? Can't you see those Morganas on approach? We don't want a battle to ruin your dress, right?
HA! Of course... Captain, for someone who has risen to the rank of military genius, you certainly hide it well...
@BATTLE
Oh, if you insist.
This doesn't count as a weakness, Captain.
Captain! Have you by chance seen a red stiletto on the bridge anywhere?
It isn’t this one sticking out of the radar, is it?
That’s the one! You sure do have a keen eye!
Not that it didn’t almost take my head off or anything…
Well, thanks!
Wait, wait, wait. What are you up to?
Me? Oh, ye of little faith! Why is it that a sweet and innocent Belle - who’s also incredibly attractive - can’t check up on her equally-as-appealing c--
VENDETTA! DID YOU FIND IT!? C’MON, THESE SHOES AREN’T GOING TO THROW THEMSELVES!
Was that Jenkins?
Your hearing must be shot, Captain. Maybe you’d see fit to take a lie down. In your quarters. Away from the deck. For the next half hour…

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been this good an actress?

Fields.DialogueText: You know us Brits! Always one for a bit of stage play. I could be a descendent of Shakespeare, you know?

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing out there?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing! Nothing at all!

Fields.MenuText: Will you be back in here to annoy me again soon?

Fields.DialogueText: Not unless Jenkins messes up another-- I MEAN… I’ll do my best not to bother you, Captain. Tehe!
*ALARM*
That does it. After we take down these Morganas, I want to see exactly what you two are doing!
Busted…
@BATTLE
There you are, Vendetta. Hurry up, it’s your turn to-- OH! Hi, Captain! I mean, aye-aye, Captain!
Is that a target board?
Yes, Captain…
And these stilettos; you’ve sharpened the edges so they can stick into the board?
Yes, Captain…
You’re playing darts with shoes.
It seemed a shame to see them go to waste, Captain! I can’t very well walk in these things, let alone fight in them!
Exactly, we were just thinking practically! You know Vendetta’s King Kong feet could never fit into something so--
*WHUD*
Right. So, who’s winning?
Well, I was until I threw that foul ball into the bridge. We have one shot left each.
*THUD*
Make that one shot left for you! I smell a bullseye!

Fields.MenuText: What’s the prize for winning?

Fields.DialogueText: Bragging rights. Whatever else?

Fields.MenuText: Are you playing by traditional darts rules?

Fields.DialogueText: But of course. We’d hate to tarnish the essence of the game by bending the formula. Jenkins! Careful with that white stiletto - it was a gift!

Fields.MenuText: Are you confident in your aim?

Fields.DialogueText: As a destroyer, it’s never really a matter of precision. More so a matter of raining hellfire down from above. Although it’s always nice to learn a new skill!
Okay! Captain, feel free to scold me after this is over. First, let me teach Jenkins a lesson!
Don’t screw this up, Vendetta. It’s bragging rights for a week for the victor.
Steady… Steady…!
*GRNNNNNN*
WAH!
*POMPF*
What was that?!
*ALARM*
The Morganas! They blindsided us.
Quickly, let’s take them out!
@BATTLE
Are you all right, Vendetta?
I think so. Although I think I sprained my wrist. I can still fight Morganas, but precise aiming will be nearly impossible...
That means I’m the winner!
Yes, I suppose it does…
It’s okay, Vendetta. You’ll get him next time.
And to think, I didn’t even want to challenge you! You were a warm-up for the real tournament going on below... I’ve said too much.
Vendetta?
I didn’t want to say, but… I taught some of the crew my stiletto throwing technique. Before I knew it, they had arranged an entire underground scene!
They planned to compete in a tournament but agreed to put a stop to it if I could beat their best player.
Jenkins is the best player!?
I didn’t want the tournament to interfere with our shipboard duties. Sorry, Captain. I’ve failed you.
Oh, no you haven’t.
Captain?
When is this tournament taking place?
A few days from now.
I’ll be there!
Captain! You can't! You mustn't! It’s too dangerous!
Then you'll have to train me, won't you? And when I win, I’ll outlaw stiletto throwing aboard my vessel.
Interesting.
Tell the crew.
With pleasure, Captain!
Captain… why?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't like the way he was treating you.

Fields.DialogueText: I can fight my own battles, but I appreciate your concern.

Fields.MenuText: I can't stand that attitude of his.

Fields.DialogueText: Neither can I. That's partially what got me into this mess.

Fields.MenuText: Why not?

Fields.DialogueText: As good a reason as any, I suppose. The same could be said of the reason why we throw shoes instead of darts.
Vendetta, can you move?
A little. Enough to take down a Morgana or two.
Great. Let's dispatch this armada and get to work!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, Captain. Firstly, tell me everything you know about stilettos.
They're shoes!
And?
You wanted more?
Strewth, this is going to be rough. What about aiming? Do you consider yourself a crack shot with a pistol?
I've shut down a fair few fates in my time by winning all the water gun prizes. I've also taken down huge armadas with my precise aiming, but that pales in comparison.
Excellent! In that case, we should...
Vendetta?
In that case, we should first debrief you on the differences between traditional darts and this game.
Stilettos are shaped differently than regulation darts and thus require a precise hand motion to be thrown correctly.
AH! Tactical Vendetta has made her debut again!
Furthermore, we're up against Jenkins. That man is not opposed to pulling out every dastardly trick in the book to attain victory, and you should be wary of his advances.
Vendetta, breathe!
Captain?
Do you think it's at all possible for you to balance this tactical, calculated side with your more destructive side?
The two are clinically opposed to one another, Captain. I would find it incredibly difficult to work with them in tandem.
In my humble opinion, I think when it comes to war, striking a balance between planning and destruction is what separates soldiers from diplomats.
I see...

Fields.MenuText: Let's try incorporating all of your skills at once!

Fields.DialogueText: It could be fruitful, I suppose.

Fields.MenuText: Let your hair down a little!

Fields.DialogueText: If you insist.

Fields.MenuText: Can we try it? For me?

Fields.DialogueText: For you?
Very well. Let me see what I can do.
*ALARM*
Just in time. This should reawaken the fighting spirit within me!
@BATTLE
So, how are you feeling?
AHA! Strange, Captain! On the one hand, the bloodlust I know and love is still coursing through my veins. But on the other, I want nothing more than to take a sample of that blood and study it!
Let's see what we can do with that.
AHA! Right! First we'll need to use my planning to train your throwing aim. Then we can use my destroyer knowledge to help tune out Jenkins' taunts and increase your throwing power.
Perfect!
We'll also need to find you a stiletto. Did you have any preference?

Fields.MenuText: This one.
That one.
The one over there.

Fields.DialogueText: This one? Hm... Lightweight, fragile. This won't do I'm afraid.
That one? Heavy, bejeweled. No, this will perform poorly, I'm afraid.
Over there? That is the reject pile, Captain. None of those shoes are tournament viable.
What about your shoe?
My shoe?
The pair you wore for our walk around that one port.
Why would you want those?
That was the pair you chose specifically to wear despite loathing all things heeled. That must count for something. They'll bring me good luck!
Very well. I'll fetch them for you.
*ALARM*
And while you're at it, maybe look into the cause for the blaring alarm as well, if you could.
@BATTLE
Captain! Take a seat! How are the training exercises I assigned to you coming along?
I'm doing my best. I never thought so much technique would go into throwing a shoe!
It's nice to finally be able to put my years of experience to good use.
You don't consider defending your homeland from a monstrous invasion a good cause?
Oh, right, that too!

Fields.MenuText: Do you already consider yourself a veteran?
Has war changed you at all?
What advice would you give to Belles on their first outing?

Fields.DialogueText: It would be the same advice I'd give to my younger self on her debut. Look sharp, question everything, and make it back alive.
I don't think so. I've always had a penchant for chaos. You could argue that war fanned that flame but, were it not for the war, I'm sure another mode of competition would have incited it anyway.
I think I have to. I'm a mature lady, Captain. I think you forget sometimes because I look so young and fresh-faced, but I've done my rounds and then some.
I could probably teach you a thing or two if you put your pride on the shelf.
*ALARM*
It was very pleasant chatting with you, Vendetta.
Same to you, Captain.
Shall we torch some hellish warships and send them tumbling down into the abyss?
Let's.
@BATTLE
Okay, everyone, we are gathered here today for the first and potentially last stiletto throwing tournament!
*CHEERING*
The Captain has graciously agreed to proceed with the duels under the proviso that, should they win, the game will be disbanded in its entirety.
Before we begin, the Captain would like to say a few words.
Men! I understand the need for down time during a lenghthy voyage. But once said hijinks impede our forward momentum, I am forced to intervene. So, let me just say that...

Fields.MenuText: I hope you can understand my thinking.

Fields.DialogueText: Worry not, Captain! We understand completely!

Fields.MenuText: Enjoy yourself while you can.

Fields.DialogueText: Spirited words from the Captain. Take his advice to heart, people!

Fields.MenuText: I will crush all of you below my boots.

Fields.DialogueText: Scary stuff from the Captain... Can anyone break his resolve?
*ALARM*
If you want to make a case for the necessity of this game, prove to me it doesn't interfere with your duties on ship! To your stations!
@BATTLE
The Captain valiantly battled their way through a horde of difficult opponents.
You can do it, Captain!
But, thanks to Vendetta's advice and sideline cheering, the Captain eventually made it to the Grand Finals. There, Jenkins was lying in wait.
So, Captain, I assume you'll excuse the use of formalities in such a situation. We're both of equal rank here, after all.
Of course. Just remember that, once I disband this game, I'll remember everything said here and will act on it accordingly.
Jenkins to throw first...
*THUD*
*THUD*
*THUD*
*CLAPPING*
And zero hesitation coming out from Jenkins as he fires each of his shots in rapid succession.
With two triple twenties and a bullseye, the Captain will need three triple twenties to come out ahead!
Vendetta, a quick word.
Normally I would frown upon mid-set coaching, but I think you're going to need all the help you can get.
What is it, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Any last-minute advice?
Do you think I can do it?
Will you be disappointed if I lose?

Fields.DialogueText: AHA! You couldn't disappoint me if you wanted to, Captain!
Don't talk like that, Captain. Being defeatist doesn't suit you. Didn't you say something like that to me once?
Remember your training. I'll be right beside you, so look over if you need a supportive wink!
*ALARM*
We'll deal with these Morganas and then continue with the Captain's throws!
@BATTLE
The Captain is stepping up to the mark. The first shot has been fired!
*THUD*
And that's a triple twenty! Nicely done.
Tch! Beginner's luck.
There goes the second!
*THUD*
Another triple twenty! Amazing!

Fields.MenuText: You look nervous, Jenkins.

Fields.DialogueText: Must be your imagination.

Fields.MenuText: Are you ready to taste defeat?

Fields.DialogueText: That's my line.

Fields.MenuText: No hard feelings?

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking the same thing.
It's been thrown! And...
Twenty! Just shy of the triple!
And Jenkins is the winner!
*APPLAUSE*
Captain... You played a good game.
Likewise.
What you said before. We appreciate you allowing us this time to blow off some steam. However, I can see we let it get a little far. We'll find other ways to alleviate stress in the future.
When did you become such a fine young man, Jenkins?
I learned from watching you and Vendetta. Your friendship is something truly special.
Is that so?
Word of advice from a stiletto throwing champion - hold on to that girl with all your might.
*ALARM*
No time for celebration, men! You already know the Captain's orders! Don't make them waste their breath!
Tch! One win and he thinks he's an admiral.
@BATTLE
Captain!
Vendetta. I'm sorry, I couldn't do it. After all your training!
*THWOMP*
Vendetta? What's with the hug? You know I lost, right?
That... was...
Incredible! For a first timer to reach the grand finals! I couldn't be more proud!

Fields.MenuText: It's all thanks to your teaching.

Fields.DialogueText: Which is all thanks to you attempting to bridge the gap between my planning and destructive side!
I feel like we're going in circles. If we keep this up, we'll be writing thank you letters to each other's parents for conceiving us!

Fields.MenuText: It's all thanks to your cheering.

Fields.DialogueText: Which is all thanks to you trying so hard!

Fields.MenuText: It's all thanks to you for initially trying to help me.

Fields.DialogueText: But you were the one who stood up to take my place!
Captain. Something's been on my mind as of late. I was wondering if you could lend an ear.
Of course. After we deal with these Morganas, I'm all yours.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So, Vendetta, what did you want to talk about?
Captain... I--
*ALARM*
Hold that thought, would you?
@BATTLE
Captain, I wanted to ask. What am I to you?

Fields.MenuText: A trusted ally.
A right nuisance.
My right hand.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that all?
That may be true, but...
You would go that far?
I'm not sure I follow.
Let me rephrase. Do you think we could be anything more than Captain and Belle?
More, you say?
Ugh! Do I have to spell it out!?
I think I see where you're going with this. I'm flattered, but--
Please be my best friend forever!
Your... your what?
I've learned so much from you, Captain, over the course of our adventures. I'd love to be promoted to a role in which I can enjoy more laughs with you in the future!
... Granted?
Yes! In your face, Jenkins! He was planning to ask the same thing after me.
Does this involve me doing anything strenuous?
We may have to shut down a wellington boot throwing contest in the near future. We Brits love a good wellie toss, you know! But I'm sure we can handle it!
Thanks, Vendetta.
No, thank you, Captain. For everything.
